additionalContactPoints.title: Additional contact points
additionalContactPoints.description: An array of additional contact points that may be consulted for information. Additional contact points should each list the languages they operate in their name, and as structured data in the availableLanguage field.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: The size or scale of the organization.

buyerProfile.title: Buyer profile URL
buyerProfile.description: The Web address of the buyer profile.

classifications.title: Organization classifications
classifications.description: The classifications that categorize the organization

shareholders.title: Organization shareholders
shareholders.description: A list of shareholders in the organization: used to provide company ownership information for firms, primarily in the case of large and complex contracts, or Public Private Partnerships, that require disclosure of this information for certain bidders or awarded parties.

beneficialOwnership.title: Beneficial ownership
beneficialOwnership.description: This section can be used to record information concerning individuals or organizations with a beneficial ownership or control interests in this party. Where structured data is available, this section may be extended by embedding or linking to information modelled using the [Beneficial Ownership Data Standard (BODS)](https://github.com/openownership/data-standard).

description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of beneficial ownership or control arrangements.

availableLanguage.title: Available languages
availableLanguage.description: The languages the contact point operates in, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.

relatedBid.title: Related bid
relatedBid.description: Where bid details are used, a cross reference to the entry in the bids array to which this award relates. Provide the bid identifier here.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this award relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract award.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: Any details relevant to the value of the concession according to article 8(3) of Directive 2014/23/EU on concession contracts.

hasSubcontracting.title: Subcontracting involved
hasSubcontracting.description: Whether a part of the contract will be subcontracted.

subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

BidsStatistic.title: Bid Statistic
BidsStatistic.description: For reporting aggregate statistics about the bids related to a tender. Where lots are in use, statistics may optionally be broken down by lot.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this statistical item.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: An item from the bidStatistics codelist for the statistic reported in value. This is an open codelist, and other statistics may also be included.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the tender process. This field can be left blank unless either (a) the same statistic is provided from multiple points in time, or (b) there is a specific local requirement for the date when statistics were calculated to be provided.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value for the measure in question. Total counts should be provided as an integer. Percentages should be presented as a proportion of 1 (e.g. 10% = 0.1)

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes required to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedLot.title: Related Lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are in use, if this statistic relates to bids on a particular lot, provide the lot identifier here. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole tender.

Bids.title: Bids
Bids.description: Summary and detailed information about bids received and evaluated as part of this contracting process.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Summary statistics on the number and nature of bids received. Where information is provided on individual bids, these statistics should match those that can be calculated from the bid details array.

details.title: Bid details
details.description: An array of bids, providing information on the bidders, and where applicable, bid status, bid values and related documents. The extent to which this information can be disclosed varies from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.

Bid.title: Bid
Bid.description: For representing a bid in response to the tender or qualification stage in this contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this bid

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this bid was received.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the bid, drawn from the bidStatus codelist

tenderers.title: Tenderer
tenderers.description: The party, or parties, responsible for this bid. This should provide a name and identifier, cross-referenced to an entry in the parties array at the top level of the release.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of the bid.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the bid and its evaluation.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this bid relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Information on the revenue to be raised through charges, as set out in the contract or as subsequently revised during the life of the project.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Reported results from the delivery of the contracted goods, works or services.

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description: A charge to be incurred by users or government over the course of the contract. Charge information can be broken down by period. Information on the unit prices upon which total values are based can be provided in the tariffs section.

id.title: Charge identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific charge. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a charge across multiple OCDS releases.

title.title: Charge title
title.description: A descriptive title for this charge.

paidBy.title: Paid by
paidBy.description: Is this a user charge (paid by businesses or citizens using the facilities provided by the contract), or a charge paid by the government?

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which this charge applies.

estimatedValue.title: Estimated value
estimatedValue.description: What is the estimated total value to be raised from this charge during this period.

actualValue.title: Actual value
actualValue.description: In the implementation section, this field may be updated with the total revenue raised from this charge during this period.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this charge. This may include clarifying information.

finance.title: Finance
finance.description: An array with details of each source of finance arranged for this contract.

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract documents.

periodRationale.title: Contract period rationale
periodRationale.description: The rationale for the duration of the contract.

publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.title: Kilometers of public passenger transport services
publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.description: The number of kilometers of public passenger transport services provided by a public service contract.

Finance.title: Financing arrangements
Finance.description: This block can be used to model details of each of the parties financing a contract or project. Note: If the finance is syndicated, and all the parties to the syndication are known, this section may be further extended with an array of syndicate partners. No schema for this is currently provided.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for this financing arrangement.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short title for this financing arrangement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of this financing arrangement. This may include details of lender rights, step in arrangements, exchange rate guarantees, and for syndicated loans, details of syndication and any banks who are known parties to the loan.

financingParty.title: Financing party
financingParty.description: The party providing this financing arrangement.

financeType.title: Finance type
financeType.description: The type of finance arranged, from the finance type codelist.

financeCategory.title: Finance category
financeCategory.description: For categorizing the nature of any financial investment. This field must be filled in for debt finance. This information can be used to identify the order of preference for investors to get their money back in cases of liquidation.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this finance.

period.title: Finance period
period.description: What period is covered by this finance.

interestRate.title: Interest rate
interestRate.description: The interest rate associated with this finance.

base.title: Base
base.description: The variable to which an additional margin amount is added to get the Interest amount. This can be specified as a fixed number, as a known variable (e.g. LIBOR), or can be omitted if margin specifies the entire interest rate.

margin.title: Margin
margin.description: The variable added to the base to give the Interest amount expressed as a decimal fraction (e.g. 12.5% = 0.125).

fixed.title: Fixed rate
fixed.description: A boolean field. If this interest rate of fixed, set to true. Otherwise, set to false.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any explanatory notes concerning the interest rate.

repaymentFrequency.title: Repayment frequency (days)
repaymentFrequency.description: What is the average repayment frequency (in days) for this source of finance. For example, for yearly, use 365; for monthly repayment use 30.4; for daily use 1. User interfaces may wish to translate this into a more user-friendly presentation, such as 'daily','monthly' or 'yearly'.

stepInRights.title: Step in rights
stepInRights.description: Does provision of this finance confer any step in rights on the financing party? Step in rights are the lender's option to assume certain contractual responsibilities of a project party through managing their contract in cases when that party is not meeting its obligations under such a contract. This is a true/false field to indicate when step in rights exist. If there are step in rights, details should be provided in the description field, and in additional contract documents.

exchangeRateGuarantee.title: Exchange rate guarantees
exchangeRateGuarantee.description: Is there an associated exchange rate guarantee with this source of finance. This is a true/false field to indicate when exchange rate guarantees exist. Details of any guarantees can be provided in the finance description, or in associated documents.

deliveryLocation.title: Delivery Location
deliveryLocation.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place.

deliveryAddress.title: Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The address to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: If this item belongs to a lot, provide the identifier of the related lot here. Each item may only belong to a single lot.

Location.title: Delivery Location
Location.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place. A location can be described by either a geometry (point location, line or polygon), or a gazetteer entry, or both.

description.title: Description
description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human readable description of the location to be covered. This description may be used in a user-interface.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: We follow the [GeoJSON standard](http://geojson.org/) to express basic location information, using longitude, latitude, and (optionally) elevation values in the [WGS84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System) (EPSG:4326) projection. A point location can be identified by geocoding a delivery address. For concession licenses, or other contracts covering a polygon location which is not contained in a known gazetteer, polygon and multi-polygon can be used.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of [GeoJSON Geometry Objects](http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#geometry-objects) being provided. To provide longitude, latitude, and (optionally) elevation, use 'Point', and enter an array of [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation] as the value of the coordinates field: e.g. [-122.085, 37.42]. Note the capitalization of type values, in order to maintain compatibility with GeoJSON.

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation], or a nested array of points, for the GeoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude MUST be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

gazetteer.title: Gazetteer
gazetteer.description: A gazetteer is a geographical index or directory. The specific gazetteer used should be specified in scheme, and one or more codes from that gazetteer used in identifier.

scheme.title: Gazetteer scheme
scheme.description: The entry of the selected gazetteer in the gazetteers codelist. The codelist provides details of services, where available, that can resolve a gazetteer entry to provide location names.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: An array of one or more codes drawn from the gazetteer indicated in scheme.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to a further description of the activity location. This may be a human readable document with information on the location, or a machine-readable description of the location.

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process may be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features can then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLots identifier is given, the values should be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Properties of tender can be overridden for a given Lot through their inclusion in the Lot object.

lotDetails.title: Lot Details
lotDetails.description: If this tender is divided into lots, details can be provided here of any criteria that apply to bidding on these lots. This extended property is currently focused on fields required by the EU TED data standard

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier may bid for as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that may be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

targets.title: Targets
targets.description: Any target metrics for this results of this contracting process.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

atypicalToolUrl.title: Atypical tool URL
atypicalToolUrl.description: Electronic communication with the procuring entity requires the use of tools and devices that are not generally available. These tools are accessible via this URL.

futureNoticeDate.title: Future notice date
futureNoticeDate.description: The estimated date of publication of the next sequential notice.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts from the procedure.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The treaties, laws, regulations or other instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

designContest.title: Design contest
designContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

reviewDetails.title: Review details
reviewDetails.description: Precise information concerning the time limits for the review procedures or contact information from which it can be obtained.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: The method used for calculating the estimated value of the concession.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether or not the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the procedure.

procurementMethodRationaleClassification.title: Procurement method rationale classifications
procurementMethodRationaleClassification.description: The classifications of the procurement method rationale.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a procedure.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids for the procedure.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this document relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this milestone relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLots references at the item, document and award level.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated value of this lot.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Information about the award criteria for the lot.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts for the lot.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the lot.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a lot.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids for the lot.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots may appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated value of the lots in this group. This may be lower than the sum total of lot values

forecasts.title: Forecasts
forecasts.description: Any forecasts metrics for this results of this contracting process.

Metric.title: Metric
Metric.description: Metrics are used to set out targets and results from a contracting process. During the planning and tender sections, a metric indicates the anticipated results. In award and contract sections it indicates the awarded/contracted results. In the implementation section it is used to provide updates on actually delivered results, also known as outputs.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this metric. In some cases this may be drawn from a codelist of metrics required for this type of contracting process, or in other instances may be an arbitrary identifier.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the metric. This may include short details of measurement methods.

observations.title: Observations
observations.description: An array of target or actual values for this metric.

Observation.title: Observation
Observation.description: An actual or target observation. Observations should include either a value (for financial metrics) or measure (for other metrics).

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific observation. This may be an arbitrary identifier, or could be a composite of the metric identifier, and the date and other dimensions of this observation.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which this observation is measured.

value.title: Value
value.description: For financial metrics, the value of this forecast, target or actual observation.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: For non-financial metrics, the measure of this forecast, target or actual observation. Measures may be provided as free text or numerical values.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. This should be an entry in the unitClassificationScheme codelist. Use of the scheme 'UNCEFACT' for the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of 'Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the schema property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Any number of dimensions can be recorded within this object. Dimensions names should follow the camelCase conventions of OCDS.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this observation. This may include clarifying information.

relatedImplementationMilestone.title: Related implementation milestone
relatedImplementationMilestone.description: A link to the milestone in the implementation section of OCDS to which this forecast, target or actual observation relates.

MilestoneReference.title: Milestone Reference
MilestoneReference.description: A block used to reference a milestone, including the ID and title of the milestone being referenced.

id.title: Milestone ID
id.description: The ID of the milestone being referenced, this must match the ID of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

title.title: Milestone title
title.description: The title of the milestone being referenced, this must match the title of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

ParticipationFee.title: Participation fee
ParticipationFee.description: A fee applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

id.title: Fee ID
id.description: A local identifier for this fee, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a fee through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

type.title: Fee type
type.description: A fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of this fee.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional information about the way in which fees are levied, or the exact nature of the fees.

methodOfPayment.title: Method(s) of payment
methodOfPayment.description: Optional information about the way in which fees can be paid.

id.title: Shareholder ID
id.description: A local identifier for this shareholder, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a shareholder through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

shareholder.title: Shareholder organization reference.
shareholder.description: An organization reference pointing the entry in the parties section for the shareholding organization.

shareholding.title: Shareholding
shareholding.description: The percentage of shares held by the shareholder, expressed as a decimal value between 0 and 1.

votingRights.title: Shareholder voting rights
votingRights.description: Specify the type of voting rights associated with the shares held by the shareholder against the voting rights codelist.

votingRightsDetails.title: Shareholder voting rights details
votingRightsDetails.description: Detailed information about the shareholder's voting rights. This field should be completed when the shareholder voting rights are restricted, additional or enhanced.

notes.title: Shareholder notes
notes.description: Additional notes on this shareholder. This field should be used to provide details on any caps on equity transfer, or lock-in arrangements, applicable to this shareholder.

weightingDescription.title: Complicated weighting description
weightingDescription.description: When the weighting cannot be expressed per criterion, the mathematical equation (or other description) that expresses the complicated (e.g. non-linear) weighting.

orderRationale.title: Justification for order of importance
orderRationale.description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighting.

type.title: Type
type.description: The aspect of the bid that the criterion concerns.

AwardCriterionNumber.title: Award criterion number
AwardCriterionNumber.description: Information about a number linked to an award criterion.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Whether the number is a type of weight.

fixed.title: Fixed
fixed.description: Whether the number is a fixed value.

threshold.title: Threshold
threshold.description: Whether the number is a type of threshold.

BidOpening.title: Bid opening
BidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the bid opening.

date.title: Date and time
date.description: The date and time of the bid opening.

location.title: Location
location.description: The place where the bid opening occurs.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address of the place where the bid opening occurs.

description.title: Details
description.description: Any other details about the bid opening (who can participate, whether authorization is needed, etc.).

ContractTerms.title: Contract terms
ContractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts.

electronicInvoicingPolicy.title: Electronic invoicing policy
electronicInvoicingPolicy.description: Whether the buyer will require, allow or not allow electronic invoices.

reservedExecution.title: Reserved execution
reservedExecution.description: Whether the execution of the contract is restricted to the framework of sheltered employment programmes.

performanceTerms.title: Terms performance
performanceTerms.description: The main information about the performance of the contract (e.g. intermediary deliverables, compensation for damages, intellectual property rights).

financialTerms.title: Financial terms
financialTerms.description: The main information about financing and payment and/or reference to any provisions that govern them.

tendererLegalForm.title: Tenderer legal form
tendererLegalForm.description: A certain legal form that must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.

hasExclusiveRights.title: Has exclusive rights
hasExclusiveRights.description: A right entitling a public service operator to operate certain public passenger transport services on a particular route or network or in a particular area, to the exclusion of any other such operator.

exclusiveRights.title: Exclusive rights
exclusiveRights.description: The nature and extent of the exclusive rights granted by the procuring entity to the contractor.

operatorRevenueShare.title: Operator revenue share
operatorRevenueShare.description: The percentage of revenue from the sale of tickets allocated to the contractor.

otherTerms.title: Other terms
otherTerms.description: Other contract terms that do not fit the semantics of any other OCDS field.

rewardsAndPenalties.title: Rewards and penalties
rewardsAndPenalties.description: Information about rewards and penalties relating to quality targets.

socialStandards.title: Social standards
socialStandards.description: The required social standards, for example: detail of the contractual rights of the staff concerned, and conditions under which employees are considered to be linked to the services.

DesignContest.title: Design contest
DesignContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

selectedParticipants.title: Selected participants
selectedParticipants.description: The parties that have already been selected to participate to the design contest.

hasPrizes.title: Has prizes
hasPrizes.description: Whether prizes will be awarded in the design contest.

prizes.title: Prizes
prizes.description: Information about the prizes awarded in the design contest.

rewardsDetails.title: Rewards details
rewardsDetails.description: The details and conditions of the payments to be made to the participants.

followUpContracts.title: Follow-up contracts
followUpContracts.description: Whether any contracts following the design contest will be awarded to the winner or winners of the design contest.

bindingJuryDecision.title: Binding jury decision
bindingJuryDecision.description: Whether the jury’s decision is binding on the procuring entity.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the jury member.

OtherRequirements.title: Other requirements
OtherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the procedure or lot.

requiresStaffNamesAndQualifications.title: Requires staff names and qualifications
requiresStaffNamesAndQualifications.description: Whether the bidders are obligated to indicate the names and professional qualifications of the staff assigned to performing the contract.

reservedParticipation.title: Reserved participation
reservedParticipation.description: The types of organizations to which participation is reserved.

qualificationSystemConditions.title: Qualification system conditions
qualificationSystemConditions.description: The conditions to be fulfilled by candidates in view of their qualification for the system.

qualificationSystemMethods.title: Qualification system methods
qualificationSystemMethods.description: The methods according to which each of the qualification system conditions will be verified.

reductionCriteria.title: Reduction criteria
reductionCriteria.description: The criteria or rules for selecting a limited number of qualified candidates to submit bids.

isAccelerated.title: Accelerated procedure used
isAccelerated.description: Whether the time limit for receipt of bids or requests to participate can be reduced due to a state of urgency.

acceleratedRationale.title: Accelerated procedure rationale
acceleratedRationale.description: The justification for using an accelerated procedure.

SecondStage.title: Second stage
SecondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

minimumCandidates.title: Minimum number of candidates
minimumCandidates.description: The minimum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

maximumCandidates.title: Maximum number of candidates
maximumCandidates.description: The maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

successiveReduction.title: Successive reduction
successiveReduction.description: The procedure will take place in successive stages. In each stage, some participants might be eliminated.

noNegotiationNecessary.title: No negotiation necessary
noNegotiationNecessary.description: The buyer or procuring entity reserves the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial bids without any further negotiations.

invitationDate.title: Invitation date
invitationDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to participate or to submit bids.

minimum.title: Minimum value or level
minimum.description: The minimum value or level of compliance a candidate needs to meet in order to participate.

Subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
Subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the part of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

maximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value
maximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted.

minimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value
minimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted.

competitiveMaximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMaximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

competitiveMinimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMinimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

value.title: Subcontracted value
value.description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

competitive.title: Competitive subcontracting
competitive.description: Whether the supplier will subcontract part of the contract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

SubmissionTerms.title: Submission terms
SubmissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids.

electronicSubmissionPolicy.title: Electronic submission policy
electronicSubmissionPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids electronically.

variantPolicy.title: Variant policy
variantPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit tenders which fulfill the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents.

electronicCataloguePolicy.title: Electronic catalogue policy
electronicCataloguePolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids as electronic catalogues.

languages.title: Submission language
languages.description: One or more languages in which bids or requests to participate can be submitted, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is recommended.

bidValidityPeriod.title: Bid valididity period
bidValidityPeriod.description: The period, from the bid submission deadline, for which bids must remain valid.

requiresGuarantees.title: Guarantees required
requiresGuarantees.description: Whether or not a financial guarantee is required.

Techniques.title: Techniques
Techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

hasFrameworkAgreement.title: Framework agreement involved
hasFrameworkAgreement.description: Whether a framework agreement is involved.

hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system involved
hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved.

dynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
dynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

hasElectronicAuction.title: Electronic auction used
hasElectronicAuction.description: Whether an electronic auction is used.

maximumParticipants.title: Maximum number of participants
maximumParticipants.description: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement. If there is no maximum, set to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity).

method.title: Method
method.description: Whether contracts are awarded with, without, or both with and without the reopening of competition.

periodRationale.title: Duration rationale
periodRationale.description: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of a framework agreement exceeds the legal limits.

buyerCategories.title: Buyer categories
buyerCategories.description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. 'all hospitals in the Tuscany region').

DynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
DynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

type.title: Type
type.description: In the case of central purchasing bodies, whether the dynamic purchasing system can be used by buyers not listed in the contracting process.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the dynamic purchasing system.

url.title: URL
url.description: The internet address of the electronic auction.

description.title: Description
description.description: Any additional information about the electronic auction.

unstructuredChanges.title: Unstructured changes
unstructuredChanges.description: Unstructured or semi-structured changes to an earlier notice.

UnstructuredChange.title: Unstructured change
UnstructuredChange.description: Unstructured or semi-structured change to an earlier notice.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: The identifier of the lot to which this change relates, if any.

oldValue.title: Old value
oldValue.description: The value of the data element referenced by the `where` field, before the change.

newValue.title: New value
newValue.description: The value of the data element referenced by the `where` field, after the change.

where.title: Where
where.description: A reference to a data element on an earlier notice that is being changed.

section.title: Section
section.description: The identifier of the section containing the data element, if the earlier notice is organized into sections.

label.title: Label
label.description: The label for the data element.

UnstructuredChangeValue.title: Unstructured change value
UnstructuredChangeValue.description: A value of a data element. The value must be described using only one of the fields `text`, `classifications` or `date`.

text.title: Text value
text.description: A text. If the change deleted or erased the data element, use the empty string ("").

bids.title: Bids
bids.description: The bid section is used to publish summary statistics, and where applicable, individual bid information.

title.title: Title
title.description: A overall title for this contracting process or release.

description.title: Description
description.description: An overall description for this contracting process or release. This should not replace provision of a detailed breakdown of the objects of the contracting process in the planning, tender, award or contracts section.
